skill.name: resilience-analysis
skill.description: Assess error handling, isolation boundaries, and recovery mechanisms in agent frameworks. Use when (1) tracing error propagation paths, (2) evaluating sandboxing for code execution, (3) understanding retry and fallback mechanisms, (4) assessing production readiness, or (5) identifying failure modes and recovery patterns.

skill.author: Dowwie

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only markdown guidance for analyzing error handling and recovery patterns in agent frameworks. No network, filesystem, or command execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Agent frameworks vary widely in error handling and recovery capabilities. This skill provides systematic methods to trace error propagation, evaluate sandboxing effectiveness, and assess production readiness before deployment.
actual_capabilities: Trace error propagation paths through agent loops
Evaluate sandboxing mechanisms for code execution
Catalog retry logic, fallbacks, and circuit breakers
Identify failure modes and recovery patterns
limitations: Does not execute code or modify frameworks
Requires codebase-mapping skill for source access
Cannot assess runtime behavior without deployment
Analysis based on static code review only

use_cases.title: Validate error handling design
use_cases.description: Systematically review error propagation and recovery patterns before releasing agent frameworks to production.

use_cases.title: Assess isolation boundaries
use_cases.description: Evaluate sandboxing mechanisms and identify potential attack vectors in untrusted code execution scenarios.

use_cases.title: Verify production readiness
use_cases.description: Confirm retry strategies, circuit breakers, and failure containment meet reliability requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Error Analysis
prompt_templates.scenario: Analyze error handling in a framework
prompt_templates.prompt: Use resilience-analysis to assess how [framework_name] handles errors. Trace the propagation paths from tool exceptions to the agent loop. Identify which errors terminate the agent versus are contained.

prompt_templates.title: Sandboxing Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate the sandboxing mechanisms in [framework_name]. What isolation level is used for code execution? Are there resource limits? Is network access controlled?

prompt_templates.title: Recovery Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Catalog all retry, fallback, and circuit breaker patterns in [framework_name]. What is the maximum retry count? What triggers circuit breaker opening? How does the framework recover from failures?

prompt_templates.title: Comprehensive Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete resilience analysis on [framework_name]. Include error propagation map, sandboxing assessment, recovery mechanism catalog, and risk assessment. Use the output template from resilience-analysis.

output_examples.input: Analyze the error handling in the AutoGPT framework
output: - LLM API errors: Retried 3x with exponential backoff, then propagated
- Tool exceptions: Wrapped and fed back to LLM for recovery
- Parser failures: Contained with retry attempt to LLM
- Code Execution: Subprocess isolation with timeout
- File System: Restricted access via allowlist
- Critical Gaps: No circuit breaker implementation
- Production Ready: Yes, with circuit breaker enhancement

best_practices: Always trace error propagation from outermost to innermost layer to identify containment gaps
Use container isolation for untrusted code execution instead of RestrictedPython alone
Implement circuit breakers for external API calls to prevent cascade failures
anti_patterns: Direct exception bubbling without wrapping or containment
Shell=True in subprocess calls with user-controlled input
No resource limits on code execution or tool operations

faq.question: Which agent frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill analyzes any agent framework written in Python, JavaScript, or other languages. It focuses on general patterns applicable across frameworks like LangChain, AutoGPT, and custom implementations.

faq.question: What limits exist for analysis depth?
faq.answer: Analysis is limited to static code review. Runtime behavior, memory leaks, and race conditions require separate testing and profiling tools.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Use codebase-mapping first to identify execution code paths. Results feed into antipattern-catalog and execution-engine-analysis for comprehensive assessment.

faq.question: Is my data safe during analysis?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads code files locally. No data is transmitted externally. All analysis occurs within your secure environment.

faq.question: Why does analysis fail on some frameworks?
faq.answer: Frameworks using metaprogramming, decorators, or code generation may hide execution paths. Consider using reflection-based analysis or examining runtime call traces.

faq.question: How does this compare to execution-engine-analysis?
faq.answer: Execution-engine-analysis focuses on control flow and concurrency. Resilience-analysis specifically targets error handling, isolation boundaries, and recovery mechanisms.
